entries.name: element
entries.desc: The element to which this attribute belongs

entries.name: normalized
entries.desc: The normalized value of this attribute.  That is, the attribute with entities intact.

entries.name: new( first, second=nil, parent=nil )
entries.desc: Constructor. FIXME: The parser doesn't catch illegal characters in attributes

entries.name: ==( other )
entries.desc: Returns true if other is an Attribute and has the same name and value, false otherwise.

entries.name: clone()
entries.desc: Returns a copy of this attribute

entries.name: element=( element )
entries.desc: Sets the element of which this object is an attribute.  Normally, this is not directly called.

entries.name: hash()
entries.desc: Creates (and returns) a hash from both the name and value

entries.name: namespace(arg=nil)
entries.desc: Returns the namespace URL, if defined, or nil otherwise

entries.name: prefix()
entries.desc: Returns the namespace of the attribute.

entries.name: remove()
entries.desc: Removes this Attribute from the tree, and returns true if successful

entries.name: to_s()
entries.desc: Returns the attribute value, with entities replaced

entries.name: to_string()
entries.desc: Returns this attribute out as XML source, expanding the name

entries.name: value()
entries.desc: Returns the UNNORMALIZED value of this attribute.  That is, entities have been expanded to their values

entries.name: write( output, indent=-1 )
entries.desc: Writes this attribute (EG, puts 'key=“value”' to the output)
